title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
hello,

820-00239 won't turn on after fall

5v was drawing 265 amps. CB408 was showing short circuit when I checked. I disassembled the CB408. No more short circuits. but keweisi opens and closes. it shows 5v

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
Probably damaged USB-C connector.
Did you test the board out of shell, using another connector?

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
I meant replacing (supposed) damaged connector.

Check voltage and diode mode to ground readings on LDOs of all CD3215 chips.

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
Voltages come and go as the device turns off and on.
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO = 3,3 volt
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA =1,8 Volt
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD = 1,8 Volt
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC = No voltage

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message: No shorts except CB408. no field with low ohms

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
only 1 entry does not turn off. Restarts on other 3 entries

[URL unfurl="true"]https://disk.yandex.com.tr/i/y0sNFS7Pgb2ePg[/URL]

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
You must get same behavior on all USB-C ports.

"diode mode to ground readings on LDOs of [B][U]all CD3215 chips[/U][/B]."
You don't need power for that...

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
I said there is no short circuit
CB408 was shorted. So could the UB400 be faulty?

U3200
PP1V1_UPC_XB_LDO_BMC = 0.486
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOD = 0.459
PP1V8_UPC_XB_LDOA = 0.492
PP3V3_UPC_XB_LDO =0.509

U3100
PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO =0.509
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA =0.483
PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOD =0.464
PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC = 0.492

ub300
PP3V3_UPC_TA_LDO =0.509
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOA =0.502
PP1V8_UPC_TA_LDOD =0.465
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC =0.492

ub400
PP3V3_UPC_TB_LDO =0.509
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOA =0.492
PP1V8_UPC_TB_LDOD=0.459
PP1V1_UPC_TB_LDO_BMC = 0.483

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
"only 1 entry does not turn off"
Is that UB400 port?

Check which port gets 1V1 LDO.
Remember, this voltage must appear only on the powered port.

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://disk.yandex.com.tr/i/y0sNFS7Pgb2ePg[/URL]
I posted a video in this link

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
ub300 won't turn off either. and it outputs a constant 1.1 volts.
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC

others show 1.1 volts. but voltage comes and goes as it turns on and off

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
only ub300 does not turn off. and it outputs a constant 1.1 volts.
PP1V1_UPC_TA_LDO_BMC

others show 1.1 volts. but voltage comes and goes as it turns on and off

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
You may have a problem on that port (UB400).
May be caused by other components, related with the USB-C connector, not UB400 itself.

Board tries to start with both charger and battery connected?

You can check diode mode on all USB-C connector pins, or use some fast tester (S-UEM2).

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message: When I check the cb309 in diode mode on another motherboard, it shows 0.502, but I can't get any value in the same part on this motherboard. Do I need to replace the UB300?

title: 820-00239-A 5V
message:
You should get same value as CB409 and other caps connected to SS pin of CD3215 chips.
OL reading means broken trace/solder.
